intro: Carlina oligocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed cudweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early autumn, producing pale yellow to white disc flowers surrounded by ray florets. Carlina oligocephala is noted for its ecological value, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
